resources.string: How to do the Amsler Grid Test?
keep your right eye closed while testing left eye.
keep your left eye closed while testing right eye.
Mark the area by drawing over the chart
Closing would terminate the test. Are you sure?
You may have central field defect. Please consult a doctor. Thanks for taking test
You donot have any central visual field defect. Thanks for taking test
Report stored to the phone storage

string-array.name: instructions
string-array.item: Testing your eyes with an Amsler grid is easy and takes only a few minutes. Here are the basic steps
Test your eyes under normal room lighting used for reading
Wear eyeglasses you normally wear for reading (even if you wear only store-bought reading glasses)
Hold the Amsler grid chart approximately 14 to 16 inches (i.e. 35 to 40 centimeters) from your eyes
Test each eye separately: Cup your hand over one eye while testing the other eye
During the test, answer the questions asked by marking on the chart

string-array.name: chart1
string-array.item: Always keep your eye focused on the dot in the centre of the grid
Do you see the central black dot?
Do any of the horizontal (---) or vertical (|) lines in the grid appear wavy, blurred or distorted?
Does any of the square look differently?(while keeping your eye on the central dot)
Are there any "holes" (missing areas) or dark areas in the grid?(while keeping your eye on the central dot)
Are any corners and sides of the grid invisible?(while keeping your eye on the central dot)

string-array.name: chart2
string-array.item: Imagine a midpoint where the 2 diagonal crossing lines connect. Always keep your eye focused in the imaginary midpoint of these diagonal lines.
Is any area not clearly visible to your eye?
Do any of the horizontal (---) or vertical (|) lines in the grid appear wavy, blurred or distorted?
Does any of the square look differently?(while keeping your eye on the central dot)
Are there any "holes" (missing areas) or dark areas in the grid?(while keeping your eye on the central dot)
Are any corners and sides of the grid invisible?(while keeping your eye on the central dot)

string-array.name: chart3
string-array.item: Always keep your eye focused on the dot in the centre of the grid
Is any red area not clearly visible to your eyes?
Do any of the horizontal (---) or vertical (|) lines in the grid appear wavy, blurred or distorted?
Are there any "holes" (missing areas) or dark areas in the grid?(while keeping your eye on the central dot)

string-array.name: chart4
string-array.item: Always keep your eye focused on the dot in the centre of the grid
Are there any "holes" (missing areas) or dark areas in the grid?(while keeping your eye on the central dot)
Are any corners and sides of the grid invisible?(while keeping your eye on the central dot)

string-array.name: chart5a
string-array.item: Always keep your eye focused on the dot in the centre of the grid
Do any of the vertical (|) lines in the grid appear wavy, blurred or distorted?
Are any corners and sides of the grid invisible?(while keeping your eye on the central dot)

string-array.name: chart7
string-array.item: Always keep your eye focused on the dot in the centre of the grid

Does any of the square look differently?(while keeping your eye on the central dot)
Do any of the horizontal (---) or vertical (|) lines in the grid appear wavy, blurred or distorted?
